articles.title: Opposition calls for no-confidence motion
articles.content: Opposition parties have submitted a no-confidence motion against the Minister of Finance, criticizing recent economic policies. articles.title: Inflation rate drops to single digits
articles.content: Consumer price inflation moderated to 8.9% in the latest reading, down from double digits earlier this year. articles.title: Electric vehicle adoption exceeds targets
articles.content: Electric vehicle registrations surpassed 50,000, ahead of government projections for the year. According to official statements, this represents a major policy shift. The decision follows extensive consultations with stakeholders and technical experts. Implementation will be phased over the next 12-18 months. Independent analysts have welcomed the move, noting its potential long-term benefits. Critics, however, raised concerns about execution capacity. A monitoring committee will oversee progress.

articles.title: Renewable energy capacity reaches 45%
articles.content: Sri Lanka achieved a milestone with 45% of electricity generation from renewable sources, mainly hydro and solar. According to official statements, this represents a major policy shift. The decision follows extensive consultations with stakeholders and technical experts.
